The entry Module¶

An entry is the foundation for a moment. It does not require a date.

An entry can have more parts, but its most simple form is:

* tags
data
\n

should either data or a tag should be required? (otherwise no way to tie it in... although a tag could be implied by location)

class moments.entry.Entry(data=u'', tags=[], source_file=u'')¶

Object to hold a unique Journal Entry

change_newlines()¶
go through and convert all rn to n
omit_tags(tags)¶

remove tags from current set of tags if they exist

scan entries.tags for each omit_tag remove it if found

render()¶
return a textual representation of the entry
render_data()¶
return a textual representation of the entry data only
render_first_line()¶
return a textual representation of the first line only
tag_links()¶
return a list of tuples for each tag’s association with all other tags

The moment Module¶

A Moment object is a subclass of Entry

Adds a timestamp and corresponding helper functions to an Entry

class moments.moment.Moment(data=u'', tags=[], created=None, closed=None, placeholder=False, source_file=u'')¶

Object to hold a unique Moment (Journal Entry with Time)

render_first_line()¶
render the date and the tags for the entry
